c74object.name: fl.multitaper~
c74object.digest: Calculates a multitaper power (or amplitude) spectrum from a real input.
c74object.description: The spectrum is calculated using the sine tapers. All FFTs use a power of two size, with zero-padding applied at the input if necessary. Output frames will be (N / 2) + 1 in length where N is the FFT size used. The number of tapers and their weighting are both controllable.

entry.name: 1. /max_length [instantiation int]
entry.description: Sets the maximum input length (and associated internal FFT size).

entry.name: 2. /num_tapers [int]
entry.description: Sets the number of tapers to use.

entry.name: 3. /normalise [bool]
entry.description: Sets normalisation on or off (such that the energy of a full-scale sine wave is 1).

entry.name: 4. /output [enum]
entry.description:
Sets whether to output values in terms of power or amplitude.
[0] - power [1] - amplitude

entry.name: 5. /weighting [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the weighting of the tapers:
uniform - all tapers are weighted equally.
linear - tapers are weighted linearly in a decreasing manner.
parabolic - tapers are weighted with a parabola in a decreasing manner.
[0] - uniform [1] - linear [2] - parabolic
